snippet: Microsoft has been secretive about its product introduction event scheduled for Monday. It’s a lot like something Apple would do.
abstract: Microsoft has been secretive about its product introduction event scheduled for Monday. It’s a lot like something Apple would do.

headline.main: Microsoft and Samsung Try Out Apple's Secret Sauce

snippet: Bret Taylor, the social network’s chief technology officer, announced Friday that he was leaving to create his own company.
abstract: Bret Taylor, the social network’s chief technology officer, announced Friday that he was leaving to create his own company.

headline.main: First Major Talent Exit After Facebook I.P.O.

snippet: The device, running a new version of the Windows operating system, would be the first computer of the company’s own design, and would be aimed squarely at Apple’s iPad.
abstract: Microsoft, taking aim at Apple's blockbuster iPad, is expected to introduce a tablet computer that runs a new version of its Windows operating system; will be the first time in Microsoft's 37-year history that it will offer a computer of its own creation.

headline.main: Microsoft Is Expected to Introduce a Tablet
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Is Expected To Introduce a Tablet

snippet: The BBC has introduced a series of video-game challenges for play on Apple devices, but it lacks some familiar, and beloved, personalities.
abstract: The BBC has introduced a series of video-game challenges for play on Apple devices, but it lacks some familiar, and beloved, personalities.

snippet: A collapse of the euro could derail America’s fragile recovery and doom Mr. Obama’s re-election hopes. He may be running out of time to sway the German chancellor.
abstract: Pres Obama's relationship with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is perhaps the best he has had with any foreign leader, but he has yet to persuade her to agree to an American-style bailout and fiscal stimulus; the two will meet again at a Group of 20 summit in Mexico.

headline.main: In Euro Crisis, Obama Looks to Merkel
headline.print_headline: In Euro Crisis, Obama Looks to Merkel

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and NICHOLAS KULISH

snippet: The Finnish company, struggling to restart its mobile phone business with Microsoft, also said it would post a wider loss in the second quarter.
abstract: Nokia will cut 10,000 jobs, or 19 percent of its work force, by the end of 2013 as part of an emergency overhaul; warns its loss is likely to be greater in the second quarter than it was in the first.

headline.main: Nokia to Cut 10,000 Jobs and Close 3 Facilities
headline.print_headline: Nokia, Faced With a Worsening Loss, Announces a Sweeping Plan to Cut 10,000 Jobs
